title: Man vs one-tonne monster
text:
60 Minutes meets the only man who can save terrorised community from monster crocodiles Lauren McMah news.com.au 60 Minutes meets the only man who can save terrorised community from monster crocodiles Lauren McMah news.com.au 60 Minutes - 'It's a bloody dangerous profession' 0:30 
60 Minutes meets the real-life Crocodile Dundee who's catching monster crocs and protecting locals. October 23rd 2015 3 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/News/ 
DEEP in the remote outback in Australia’s Top End lurk crocodiles so huge, one of them is said to weigh one massive tonne. 
Locals say they’ve been terrorised by this growing gnash of monster reptiles. The crocs have been snapping up horses and livestock, and a few years ago almost took a young boy’s life. 
Community elders know there is only one man to help: Matt Wright, a real-life Crocodile Dundee, who they’ve asked to hunt, capture and relocate the ferocious beasts. Producer Nick Greenaway and Peter Stefanovic with the smaller of the rogue crocs caught. One of the crocodiles after it had been captured. Picture: Nick Greenaway A monster croc up close. Picture: Nick Greenaway The 60 Minutes crew and Matt Wright’s team with the first of two rogue crocs caught at Peppimenarti in the Northern Territory. Matt Wright, better known as the Outback Wrangler, with his proud mum Maree. Picture: Nick Greenaway The crew keep the croc at bay. The crew zipped around the waterways in Matt Wright’s chopper. 1 of n 
And tonight on 60 Minutes at 8:30pm on Channel Nine a gung-ho Peter Stefanovic joins Wright on his wild and risky mission to do just that. 
“It was incredible. These crocs are very big and very wild and very dangerous. We got a really close-up view of them all in action,” Stefanovic told news.com.au. 
“On the first day we caught about a 10-foot (three-metre) female, but then on the final couple of days we caught the giants — we caught a 16-foot (4.9-metre) male, and then the next day we caught a 17-foot (5.2-metre) male and that was the biggest. Other Stories
